title: A Wes Anderson Palette Generator
text: Assignment Details: https://github.com/karthik/wesanderson https://jhu-statprogramming-fall-2022.github.io/biostat840-project3-pkgdown-kinnaryshah customizations: added theme pulse, changed navigation bar height, changed syntax highlighting code blocks, changed navigation bar color, changed footer structure author project Kinnary Shah, author original package Karthik Ram. saved boring plots. ever ? - Max Fischer (probably) Tired generic mass produced palettes plots? Short adding owl dressing plot bowler hat, ’s indie thing can one. First round palettes derived amazing Tumblr blog Wes Anderson Palettes user karthik.

title: A Wes Anderson Palette Generator
code: wes_palette("Royal1") wes_palette("Royal2") library("ggplot2") ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(cyl), fill=factor(vs))) +  geom_bar() +   scale_fill_manual(values = wes_palette("Royal1"))

what: The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou (2004)
title: A Wes Anderson Palette Generator
code: wes_palette("Zissou1") pal <- wes_palette("Zissou1", 21, type = "continuous") image(volcano, col = pal) pal <- wes_palette("Zissou1", 100, type = "continuous") # heatmap is a local dataset ggplot(heatmap, aes(x = X2, y = X1, fill = value)) +   geom_tile() +    scale_fill_gradientn(colours = pal) +    scale_x_discrete(expand = c(0, 0)) +   scale_y_discrete(expand = c(0, 0)) +    coord_equal()

title: A Wes Anderson palette generator — wes_palette
A Wes Anderson palette generator — wes_palette
text: name Name desired palette. Choices : BottleRocket1, BottleRocket2,  Rushmore1, Royal1, Royal2,  Zissou1, Darjeeling1, Darjeeling2,  Chevalier1 , FantasticFox1 , Moonrise1, Moonrise2, Moonrise3, Cavalcanti1, GrandBudapest1, GrandBudapest2, IsleofDogs1, IsleofDogs2 n Number colors desired. Unfortunately palettes now 4 5 colors. hopefully add palettes soon. color schemes derived excellent Tumblr blog: Wes Anderson Palettes. omitted, uses colours. type Either "continuous" "discrete". Use continuous want automatically interpolate colours. @importFrom graphics rgb rect par image text

title: A Wes Anderson palette generator — wes_palette
A Wes Anderson palette generator — wes_palette
code: wes_palette("Royal1")  wes_palette("GrandBudapest1")  wes_palette("Cavalcanti1")  wes_palette("Cavalcanti1", 3)   # If you need more colours than normally found in a palette, you # can use a continuous palette to interpolate between existing # colours pal <- wes_palette(21, name = "Zissou1", type = "continuous") image(volcano, col = pal)

title: Complete list of palettes — wes_palettes
text: Use wes_palette construct palettes desired length.
